verbs.description: muscularize (third-person singular simple present muscularizes, present participle muscularizing, simple past and past participle muscularized)

entries.meaning: To increase the size of the muscles.
examples: Advanced freehand exercises shape and muscularize the body in a unique way; all the world's best-built men include them in their workouts.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make (something) more masculine, virile, or militaristic.
examples: Perhaps the most famous example of this impulse to muscularize Christianity in the early twentieth century was evangelist Billy Sunday.
